---
title: "Anova e AACPD"
format: html
editor: visual

mensage: false
---


## Anova de Blocos Casualizados

A análise de variância em blocos casualizados (ANOVA em DBC) é um método estatístico utilizado para comparar o efeito de diferentes tratamentos em um experimento quando há um fator de bloqueio que pode influenciar os resultados. Essa técnica é particularmente útil quando os dados apresentam heterogeneidade em um grupo, por exemplo, devido a diferenças no solo em um experimento agrícola.


::: {.cell hash='aula8_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-1_11233a6777f3c81a097d0a87b4e32157'}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(tidyverse)
library(gsheet)
library(patchwork)
library(ggplot2)
library(ggthemes)
library(performance)
library(emmeans)
library(multcomp)
library(MASS)
library(DHARMa)
library(forcats)
library(writexl)
library(epifitter)
library(agricolae)

soja <- gsheet2tbl("https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1bq2N19DcZdtax2fQW9OHSGMR0X2__Z9T/edit#gid=866852711")

soja <- soja |>
  mutate(TRAT = as.factor(TRAT),
         BLOCO = as.factor(BLOCO))


dfc <- soja |>
  ggplot(aes(TRAT, DFC))+
  geom_jitter(width = 0.05, color = "gray70")+
  stat_summary(fun.data = "mean_cl_boot", color = "black",
               alpha = 0.5)
dfc
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](aula8_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-1-1.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
fer <- soja |>
  ggplot(aes(TRAT, FER))+
  geom_jitter(width = 0.05, color = "gray70")+
  stat_summary(fun.data = "mean_cl_boot", color = "black",
               alpha = 0.5)
fer
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](aula8_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-1-2.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
prod <- soja |>
  ggplot(aes(TRAT, PROD))+
  geom_jitter(width = 0.05, color = "gray70")+
  stat_summary(fun.data = "mean_cl_boot", color = "black",
               alpha = 0.5)
prod
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](aula8_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-1-3.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
(dfc / fer / prod)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](aula8_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-1-4.png){width=672}
:::
:::


## Anova de dfc


::: {.cell hash='aula8_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-2_cfbdc5933dbc4f245c0a109cdfbf2921'}

```{.r .cell-code}
aov_dfc <- lm (DFC ~ TRAT + BLOCO,
               data = soja)

anova(aov_dfc)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
Analysis of Variance Table

Response: DFC
          Df  Sum Sq Mean Sq F value    Pr(>F)    
TRAT       7 149.299 21.3284 51.5490 8.218e-12 ***
BLOCO      3   0.461  0.1537  0.3716    0.7743    
Residuals 21   8.689  0.4138                      
---
Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
check_normality(aov_dfc)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
OK: residuals appear as normally distributed (p = 0.978).
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
check_heteroscedasticity(aov_dfc)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
OK: Error variance appears to be homoscedastic (p = 0.532).
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
medias_dfc <- emmeans(aov_dfc, ~ TRAT)
medias_dfc
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
 TRAT emmean    SE df lower.CL upper.CL
 1     10.88 0.322 21    10.21    11.54
 2      6.42 0.322 21     5.76     7.09
 3      6.05 0.322 21     5.38     6.72
 4      4.75 0.322 21     4.08     5.42
 5      4.20 0.322 21     3.53     4.87
 6      4.00 0.322 21     3.33     4.67
 7      4.08 0.322 21     3.41     4.74
 8      4.58 0.322 21     3.91     5.24

Results are averaged over the levels of: BLOCO 
Confidence level used: 0.95 
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
pwpm(medias_dfc)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
        1       2       3       4       5       6       7       8
1 [10.87]  <.0001  <.0001  <.0001  <.0001  <.0001  <.0001  <.0001
2   4.450 [ 6.42]  0.9896  0.0249  0.0017  0.0006  0.0009  0.0107
3   4.825   0.375 [ 6.05]  0.1329  0.0107  0.0040  0.0058  0.0628
4   6.125   1.675   1.300 [ 4.75]  0.9202  0.7173  0.8072  0.9999
5   6.675   2.225   1.850   0.550 [ 4.20]  0.9998  1.0000  0.9896
6   6.875   2.425   2.050   0.750   0.200 [ 4.00]  1.0000  0.9020
7   6.800   2.350   1.975   0.675   0.125  -0.075 [ 4.07]  0.9499
8   6.300   1.850   1.475   0.175  -0.375  -0.575  -0.500 [ 4.57]

Row and column labels: TRAT
Upper triangle: P values   adjust = "tukey"
Diagonal: [Estimates] (emmean) 
Lower triangle: Comparisons (estimate)   earlier vs. later
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
cld(medias_dfc, Letters = LETTERS)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
 TRAT emmean    SE df lower.CL upper.CL .group
 6      4.00 0.322 21     3.33     4.67  A    
 7      4.08 0.322 21     3.41     4.74  A    
 5      4.20 0.322 21     3.53     4.87  A    
 8      4.58 0.322 21     3.91     5.24  AB   
 4      4.75 0.322 21     4.08     5.42  AB   
 3      6.05 0.322 21     5.38     6.72   BC  
 2      6.42 0.322 21     5.76     7.09    C  
 1     10.88 0.322 21    10.21    11.54     D 

Results are averaged over the levels of: BLOCO 
Confidence level used: 0.95 
P value adjustment: tukey method for comparing a family of 8 estimates 
significance level used: alpha = 0.05 
NOTE: If two or more means share the same grouping symbol,
      then we cannot show them to be different.
      But we also did not show them to be the same. 
```
:::
:::


## Anova de fer


::: {.cell hash='aula8_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-3_a7c02a77dbe71d17d93eb5660cf55750'}

```{.r .cell-code}
b <- boxcox(lm(soja$FER + 0.1 ~ 1))
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](aula8_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-3-1.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
lambda <- b$x[which.max(b$y)]
max(b$y)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
[1] -27.73007
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
soja$FER2 <- (soja$FER ^ lambda - 1) / lambda

aov_FER2 <- lm (FER2 ~ TRAT + BLOCO,
               data = soja)

anova(aov_FER2)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
Analysis of Variance Table

Response: FER2
          Df   Sum Sq   Mean Sq F value    Pr(>F)    
TRAT       7 0.036632 0.0052332 12.5567 3.033e-06 ***
BLOCO      3 0.005360 0.0017865  4.2867    0.0165 *  
Residuals 21 0.008752 0.0004168                      
---
Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
check_normality(aov_FER2)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
OK: residuals appear as normally distributed (p = 0.790).
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
check_heteroscedasticity(aov_FER2)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
OK: Error variance appears to be homoscedastic (p = 0.834).
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
medias_FER2 <- emmeans(aov_FER2, ~ TRAT, type = "response")
medias_FER2
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
 TRAT emmean     SE df lower.CL upper.CL
 1     0.621 0.0102 21    0.600    0.642
 2     0.584 0.0102 21    0.563    0.605
 3     0.543 0.0102 21    0.522    0.564
 4     0.519 0.0102 21    0.498    0.540
 5     0.530 0.0102 21    0.509    0.551
 6     0.515 0.0102 21    0.494    0.536
 7     0.536 0.0102 21    0.515    0.557
 8     0.540 0.0102 21    0.519    0.561

Results are averaged over the levels of: BLOCO 
Confidence level used: 0.95 
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
pwpm(medias_FER2)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
         1        2        3        4        5        6        7       8
1  [0.621]   0.2155   0.0005   <.0001   <.0001   <.0001   0.0002  0.0003
2  0.03732  [0.584]   0.1390   0.0040   0.0221   0.0021   0.0527  0.0928
3  0.07823  0.04091  [0.543]   0.7065   0.9822   0.5351   0.9996  1.0000

8  0.08131  0.04398  0.00308 -0.02100 -0.00999 -0.02507 -0.00407 [0.540]

Row and column labels: TRAT
Upper triangle: P values   adjust = "tukey"
Diagonal: [Estimates] (emmean)   type = "response"
Lower triangle: Comparisons (estimate)   earlier vs. later
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}

```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

## Anova de prod


::: {.cell hash='aula8_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-4_5a4c800efd5ae1be7d0e9382872d108d'}

```{.r .cell-code}
aov_prod <- lm (PROD ~ TRAT + BLOCO,
               data = soja)

anova(aov_prod)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
Analysis of Variance Table

Response: PROD
          Df  Sum Sq Mean Sq F value  Pr(>F)  
TRAT       7 2993906  427701  2.6367 0.04021 *
BLOCO      3  105665   35222  0.2171 0.88340  
Residuals 21 3406431  162211                  
---
Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
check_normality(aov_prod)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
OK: residuals appear as normally distributed (p = 0.542).
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
check_heteroscedasticity(aov_prod)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
OK: Error variance appears to be homoscedastic (p = 0.215).
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
medias_prod <- emmeans(aov_prod, ~ TRAT)
medias_prod
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
 TRAT emmean  SE df lower.CL upper.CL

 6      5256 201 21     4837     5675
 7      5128 201 21     4709     5546
 8      5078 201 21     4659     5497

Results are averaged over the levels of: BLOCO 
Confidence level used: 0.95 
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
pwpm(medias_prod)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
        1       2       3       4       5       6       7      8
1  [4219]  0.2430  0.0792  0.0640  0.0728  0.0272  0.0700 0.0985
```

:::

```{.r .cell-code}
medias_prod_grupo <- cld(medias_prod, Letters = LETTERS)
```
:::


## Gráficos Com os Dados


::: {.cell hash='aula8_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-5_0ad32e296ec9426354393b6809007844'}

```{.r .cell-code}
df_prod <- data.frame(medias_prod_grupo)
df_prod |>
  ggplot(aes(TRAT, emmean))+
  geom_point()+
  ylim(3000, 6500)+
  geom_errorbar(aes(min = lower.CL,
                    max = upper.CL),
                width = 0.1)+
  annotate(geom = "text", x = 1.2,  y = 4200,
           label = "A")
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](aula8_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-5-1.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
knitr::kable(df_prod |> dplyr:: select(TRAT, emmean))
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
|   |TRAT |  emmean|
|:--|:----|-------:|
|1  |1    | 4219.25|
|2  |2    | 4935.00|
|8  |8    | 5078.25|
|3  |3    | 5110.00|
|5  |5    | 5122.00|
|7  |7    | 5127.50|
|4  |4    | 5140.25|
|6  |6    | 5256.25|
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
write_xlsx(df_prod, "df.xlsx")
```
:::


## Dados Curve AACPD

A Área abaixo da Curva de Progresso da Doença (AACPD) é um parâmetro quantitativo utilizado em diversos patossistemas para analisar o progresso de doenças em plantas. A AACPD é obtida através da integração da curva de progresso da doença, que representa a relação entre a severidade da doença e o tempo. Essa área fornece uma medida cumulativa da intensidade da doença ao longo do tempo, permitindo uma avaliação mais abrangente do impacto da doença na cultura.


::: {.cell hash='aula8_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-6_5d4ed8e232edc28c6c0522a7988598a8'}

```{.r .cell-code}
curve <- gsheet2tbl("https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1bq2N19DcZdtax2fQW9OHSGMR0X2__Z9T/edit#gid=1807247585")

Irrigation <- curve |>
  ggplot(aes(day, severity))+
  geom_jitter(width = 0.05, color = "darkblue")+
  stat_summary(fun.data = "mean_cl_boot", color = "black",
               alpha = 0.5)+
  facet_wrap(~~ Irrigation)
Irrigation
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](aula8_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-6-1.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
curve |>
  group_by(day, Irrigation) |>
  summarise(mean_sev = mean (severity)) |>
  ggplot(aes(day, mean_sev))+
  geom_point()+
  geom_line(color = "red")+
  facet_wrap(~~Irrigation)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](aula8_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-6-2.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
curve2 <- curve |>
  group_by(Irrigation, rep) |>
  summarise(aacpd = AUDPC(day, severity))

m_curve <- lm(aacpd ~ Irrigation + factor(rep),
              data = curve2)

anova(m_curve)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
Analysis of Variance Table

Response: aacpd
            Df  Sum Sq  Mean Sq F value  Pr(>F)  
Irrigation   1 0.23602 0.236017  10.605 0.08275 .
factor(rep)  2 0.61291 0.306454  13.771 0.06770 .
Residuals    2 0.04451 0.022254                  
---
Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
cv.model(m_curve)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
[1] 1.097572
```
:::
:::
